question.text: Select the incorrect statement with respect to aeration tank of the sewage treatment plant.

options.text: In this tank microbes consume the major part of organic matter.
Flocs contain aerobic fungal and anaerobic bacteria.
The primary effluent is constantly agitated mechanically and air is pumped into it.

solution.text:
Sewage treatment plants (STPs) - There are two stages of treatment :

A. Primary treatment

-It involves the physical removal of the small and large sized particles from the sewage.

-Processes involved :

1. Filtration 2. Sedimentation

B. Secondary treatment or Biological treatment

-It involves the physical removal of the small and large sized particles from the sewage.

-Mechanism

Step 1 - Primary effluent is passed into large aeration tanks in which constant agitation and pumping of air is there → Growth of microorganisms (specially aerobic) is promoted → Flocs (large asses of bacteria along with fungal filaments to appear like a mesh like network) are formed

These microbes take oxygen during their growth (thus increasing the BOD) and decompose or consume major organic part of the effluent.

Step 2- Once the BOD is significantly decreased, effluent is transferred to a large settling tank → Bacterial flocs settle here, which are termed as activated sludge.

Step 3 - A small part of the activated sludge is transferred back into the aeration tank to act as inoculum.

Step 4 - Major part of the activated sludge is pumped into the anaerobic sludge digesters which are large tanks having anaerobic bacteria → These anaerobic bacteria digest the bacteria and fungi present in the sludge → In this process of digestion, various gases are produced in the form of a mixture - Methane, hydrogen sulphide and carbon dioxide. These gases are collectively termed as biogas.

Flocs contain aerobic bacteria and fungus to reduce BOD of H2O . Aerobic bacteria uses oxygen to decompose organic matter.
